DataElement.preferredName: Patient Intolerance Oral Medication Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions that prevent a person from being allowed to participate in a clinical study that address the inability to absorb or metabolize pharmacological medication through the mouth as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Intolerance Oral Medication Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures._An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way._A pharmacological medication intended for administration through the mouth._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient unable to reliable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to reliable tolerate and/or receive oral medications?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was patient unable to tolerate prior irinotecan treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to tolerate oral medication or keep a pill diary?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient unable to tolerate oral formulation of study drug at enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have expected inability to tolerate oral formulation (e.g., unable swallow whole tablets) of letermovir?
